SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Keep Your Global Data Up-to-Date After Upgrading

Have confidence that your upgrade has completed successfully. B2B Commerce for Visualforce now checks for missing global custom settings records and configuration settings when you upgrade.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: Previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce checked for missing global custom settings (such as page labels) as you installed a new version of the managed package. B2B Commerce for Visualforce automatically reinserted any missing global custom settings during installation.

Now, B2B Commerce for Visualforce checks for missing global custom settings when both of the following conditions are true: and

You click Upgrade from the Data Loader page of CC Admin Global Settings.
The new version of the managed package adds global custom settings.

Also, previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce sometimes added new configuration settings in patch releases, but you had to manually create the configuration metadata in your org. With this change, clicking Upgrade after installing a patch adds new configuration metadata automatically.

title: Upgrade Guide for B2B Commerce on Visualforce
